page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: When invesigating our 'D' block wefound much evidence of the Stokes Bay Lines. These fortifications were constructed by the Royal Engineers under the instruction of Lord Palmerston. This line was constructed to linkthe Elson-Gomer line of forts with the Blockhouse-Monckton-Gilkicker Forts. A moat extended from Fort Monckton to the rear of Browndown Battery in front of Fort Gomer, a distance of some 2,700 yards. The north west boundary of our 'D' block is formed by the wall of Bay House, once the home of Lord Ashburton and is now a comprehensive school.
